Description:
Detects suspicious manipulations of default accounts such as 'administrator' and 'guest'. For example 'enable' or 'disable' accounts or change the password...etc

Author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
Sigma Repository: [GitHub](https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma)
Name: Suspicious Manipulation Of Default Accounts Via Net.EXE
Query: sourcetype='windows-sysmon' eql select * from _source_ where ((command like '% user %' and (command like '% järjestelmänvalvoja %' or command like '% rendszergazda %' or command like '% администратор %' or command like '% administrateur %' or command like '% administrador %' or command like '% administratör %' or command like '% administrator %' or command like '% guest %' or command like '% defaultaccount %' or command like '% "järjestelmänvalvoja" %' or command like '% "rendszergazda" %' or command like '% "администратор" %' or command like '% "administrateur" %' or command like '% "administrador" %' or command like '% "administratör" %' or command like '% "administrator" %' or command like '% "guest" %' or command like '% "defaultaccount" %' or command like '% 'järjestelmänvalvoja' %' or command like '% 'rendszergazda' %' or command like '% 'администратор' %' or command like '% 'administrateur' %' or command like '% 'administrador' %' or command like '% 'administratör' %' or command like '% 'administrator' %' or command like '% 'guest' %' or command like '% 'defaultaccount' %') and ((process_path like '%\net.exe' or process_path like '%\net1.exe') and (original_file_name = 'net.exe' or original_file_name = 'net1.exe'))) and  not (command like '%guest%' and command like '%/active no%'))
